Key Match Events: The New York Knicks lost their third straight game to the injured Orlando Magic at Madison Square Garden by a 103-94 final.
Orlando limited New York to just 17 points in the third quarter.
Jalen Brunson tied for a team-high with 24 points but shot 8 of 21 from the field.
Mikal Bridges also scored 24 points but struggled from three-point range, shooting 1-for-7.
The Knicks shot 4 of 22 from three-point land.
Cole Anthony scored a team-high 24 points for the Magic on 50% shooting, including 3 of 6 from beyond the arc.
Kentavious Caldwell-Pope contributed 15 points for the Magic.
Pre-Game Insights: Karl-Anthony Towns warmed up before the game but decided to sit out due to a hamstring injury.
Duece McBride also missed the game due to injury.
Post-Match Reflections: The New York Knicks look tired and have played a heavy schedule recently.
Tom Thibodeau's bench is thin, and the team needs reinforcements.
Leon Rose must hit the phones for some reinforcements, while Thibodeau has to expand his bench.
